Package ussr.physics

An abstract model of a physics engine, serves as the interface between physics-engine independent classes and the physics engine.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ModuleFactory A module factory creates robot modules in a simulation instance.
PhysicsConnector A simulated physical connector, useable independently of the underlying physics engine.
PhysicsEntity Abstract interface for any kind of physics entity, allowing physicsal attributes of the entity to be determined
PhysicsModuleComponent A simulated physical module, useable independently of the underlying physics engine.
PhysicsObserver The physics simulation notifies observers (as per the observer design pattern) at each time step, allowing code to potentially be run at every physics step.
PhysicsSimulation A physics simulation, defined independently of the underlying physics engine.
PhysicsSimulation.Handler An ultra-simple user-input handler
PhysicsSimulationHelper A helper class for physics simulations, containing various utility methods that can be applied to the PhysicsSimulation object associated with this helper.
SimulationGadget A simulation gadget is a plugin that allows some aspect of the user interface to be tailored to the specific simulation that is running
SimulationGadget.Host  
SimulationGadget.Textual  
 

Class Summary
PhysicsFactory An factory for creating implementation-level objects used by higher-level parts of the simulator (currently only the simulator itself).
PhysicsLogger Container for various logging-related functionality in the simulator.
PhysicsParameters A collection of parameters that describe the physical properties of the simulation.
PhysicsQuaternionHolder Utility class allowing the physics-engine specific representation of a quaternion generated by the physics engine to be stored at the abstract model level of the software.
PhysicsVectorHolder Utility class allowing the physics-engine specific representation of a vector generated by the physics engine to be stored at the abstract model level of the software.
 

Enum Summary
PhysicsParameters.Material  
 

Package ussr.physics Description

An abstract model of a physics engine, serves as the interface between physics-engine independent classes and the physics engine. The classes PhysicsSimulation and PhysicsSimulationHelper describes the general capabilities of a physics simulation. The class PhysicsParameters defines the parameters that can be set to control the physics behavior of the simulation.
